file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 28-21-13-04 - FUEL LINE JOINTS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL FUEL LINE JOINTS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the joints of the fuel lines of the aircraft. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ACFT WITH WET 28-21-13-000-801-A FUEL LINE JOINTS - REMOVAL WINGSTUB ACFT WITH WET 28-21-13-400-801-A FUEL LINE JOINTS - INSTALLATION WINGSTUB ACFT WITH DRY 28-21-13-000-802-A FUEL LINE JOINTS - REMOVAL WINGSTUB ACFT WITH DRY 28-21-13-400-802-A FUEL LINE JOINTS - INSTALLATION WINGSTUB EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 28-21-13 Page 1 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-21-13-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT WITH WET WINGSTUB 2. FUEL LINE JOINTS - REMOVAL A. General (1) Obey the instructions below to remove the fuel line joints. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-802-A/300 FUEL-TANK PRESSURE DEFUELING - SERVICING AMM TASK 28-11-01-000-801-A/400 FUEL-TANK ACCESS PANELS - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 192 192BR Center lower fairing 192 192AL Center lower fairing 155 155DZ LH main landing gear compartment 155 155EZ LH main landing gear compartment 156 156CZ RH wing stub 156 156EZ RH main landing gear compartment 156 156DZ RH main landing gear compartment 156 156BZ RH wing stub D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Wing stub undersurface EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 28-21-13 Page 2 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO MATERIAL. (1) Defuel the RH or LH tank ( AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-802-A/300). If necessary. (2) On the circuit breaker panel, open the circuit breakers below and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to them. – FUEL PUMPS 1A/1B/1C. – FUEL PUMPS 2A/2B/2C. – START 1/2. (3) Remove the access panels 192BR, 192AL, 155DZ, 155EZ, 156CZ, 156EZ, 156DZ or 156BZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 and AMM TASK 28-11-01-000-801-A/400), as applicable. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the tie-down straps (1) or locking wires (2), as applicable, and discard them. Refer to Figure 401. (2) Loosen the clamp and remove the Gamah joints (3). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 28-21-13 Page 3 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ACFT WITH WET WINGSTUB Fuel Line Joints - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A B/C 1 2. LOCKING WIRE B/C (2 POSITIONS-INSTALL) DET. A 2 W 3 LOCKING 1. TIE-DOWN STRAP HANDLE (2 POSITIONS-INSTALL) (REF.) 2 Z CLAMP LOCKING (REF.) HANDLE (REF.) DET. C CLAMP (TYPICAL) 3. GAMAH JOINT (REF.) 3. GAMAH JOINT DET. B 1 (TYPICAL) 3 2. LOCKING WIRE (2 POSITIONS-INSTALL) 1. TIE-DOWN STRAP (2 POSITIONS-INSTALL) HINGE (REF.) HINGE (REF.) 3. GAMAH JOINT 2 2 3. GAMAH VIEW W JOINT VIEW Z 1 APPLY TWO TURNS OF LOCKING WIRE AT EACH POSITION. 2 IF APPLICABLE, THE LOCKING WIRE/TIE-DOWN STRAP MUST BE POSITIONED UNDER THE HINGE PIN ENDS AND LOCKING HANDLE. 3 NOT APPLICABLE TO FAA-CERTIFIED AIRCRAFT. 145AMM280296B.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 28-21-13 Page 4 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-21-13-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT WITH WET WINGSTUB 3. FUEL LINE JOINTS - INSTALLATION A. General (1) Obey the instructions below to install the fuel line joints. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM MPP 28-11-01/400 - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-801-A/300 FUEL-TANK PRESSURE REFUELING - SERVICING AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 192 192BR Center lower fairing 192 192AL Center lower fairing 155 155DZ LH main landing gear compartment 155 155EZ LH main landing gear compartment 156 156CZ RH wing stub 156 156EZ RH main landing gear compartment 156 156DZ RH main landing gear compartment 156 156BZ RH wing stub D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MS20995C32 Lockwire AR MS3367-7-9 Tie-down straps, if applicable AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 28-21-13 Page 5 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Wing stub undersurface I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO MATERIAL. (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the circuit breakers below and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to them. – FUEL PUMPS 1A/1B/1C. – FUEL PUMPS 2A/2B/2C. – START 1/2. (2) Remove the protection caps or plugs from the disconnected points, if applicable. J. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A CAUTION: MAKE SURE THAT THE FAYING SURFACES BETWEEN THE GAMAH JOINT AND THE FUEL TUBE ARE CLEAN TO PREVENT AN UNSATISFACTORY ELECTRICAL BONDING. (1) Install the Gamah joints (3). CAUTION: DO NOT USE LOCKWIRE ON UNITS OR FITTINGS IN THE FUEL TANKS. THE ENDS OF THE LOCKWIRES CAN BE POINTS OF THE ELECTROSTATIC DISCHARGE. (2) (CTA-, JAA- AND IAC-AR-CERTIFIED AIRCRAFT ONLY) In the wing stub dry region area, install the tie-down straps (1) or locking wires (2). NOTE: Use a tie-down strap or a locking wire to hold each end of the Gamah joint. If applicable, apply two turns of the locking wire at each position. (3) (FAA-CERTIFIED AIRCRAFT ONLY) In the wing stub dry region area, install the locking wires (2). NOTE: Use a locking wire to hold each end of the Gamah joint. If applicable, apply two turns of the locking wire at each position. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Do an inspection on the fuel quantity indication harness (AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 28-21-13 Page 6 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL NOTE: The inspection of fuel quantity indication harness is a part of Critical Design Configuration Control Limitations (CDCCL) in the Airworthiness Limitations of the Maintenance Review Board Report (MRB). (2) Install access panels 192BR, 192AL, 155DZ, 155EZ, 156CZ, 156EZ, 156DZ or 156BZ (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 and AMM MPP 28-11-01/400), as applicable. (3) Refuel the RH or LH tank ( AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-801-A/300), as applicable. (4) Examine for fuel leakage the access panels which were removed. (5) On the circuit breaker panel, close the circuit breakers below and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from them: • FUEL PUMPS 1A/1B/1C. • FUEL PUMPS 2A/2B/2C. • START 1/2. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 28-21-13 Page 7 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 28-21-13-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT WITH DRY WINGSTUB 4. FUEL LINE JOINTS - REMOVAL A. General (1) Obey the instructions below to remove the Fuel Line Joints. B. Preparation SUBTASK 841-004-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO MATERIAL. (1) Defuel the LH or RH tank, as applicable ( AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-802-A/300). (2) On the circuit breaker panel, open the circuit breakers below and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to them. – FUEL PUMPS 1A/1B/1C. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 28-21-13 Page 8 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL – FUEL PUMPS 2A/2B/2C. – START 1/2. (3) Open access panels 192AL and 192BR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100) to get access to the fuel line joints. J. Removal (Figure 402) (Figure 403) SUBTASK 020-003-A (1) Remove the tie-down straps (1) or locking wires (2), as applicable, and discard them. Refer to Figure 402 and Figure 403. (2) Loosen the clamp and remove the Gamah joints (3). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 28-21-13 Page 9 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-005-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK, OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 28-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO MATERIAL. (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the circuit breakers below and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to them. – FUEL PUMPS 1A/1B/1C. – FUEL PUMPS 2A/2B/2C. – START 1/2. (2) Remove the protection caps or plugs from the disconnected points, if applicable. J. Installation (Figure 402) (Figure 403) SUBTASK 420-003-A CAUTION: MAKE SURE THAT THE FAYING SURFACES BETWEEN THE GAMAH JOINT AND THE FUEL TUBE ARE CLEAN TO PREVENT AN UNSATISFACTORY ELECTRICAL BONDING. (1) Install the Gamah joints (3). CAUTION: DO NOT USE LOCKWIRE ON UNITS OR FITTINGS IN THE FUEL TANKS. THE ENDS OF THE LOCKWIRES CAN BE POINTS OF THE ELECTROSTATIC DISCHARGE. (2) (CTA-, JAA- AND IAC-AR-CERTIFIED AIRCRAFT ONLY) In the wing stub dry region area, install the tie-down straps (1) or locking wires (2). NOTE: Use a tie-down strap or a locking wire to hold each end of the Gamah joint. If applicable, apply two turns of the locking wire at each position. (3) (FAA-CERTIFIED AIRCRAFT ONLY) In the wing stub dry region area, install the locking wires (2). NOTE: Use a locking wire to hold each end of the Gamah joint. If applicable, apply two turns of the locking wire at each position. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) Do an inspection on the fuel quantity indication harness (AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600). NOTE: The inspection of fuel quantity indication harness is a part of Critical Design Configuration Control Limitations (CDCCL) in the Airworthiness Limitations of the Maintenance Review Board Report (MRB). (2) Close access panels 192AL and 192BR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 and AMM MPP 28-11-01/400), as applicable. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 28-21-13 Page 13 of 14 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Refuel the tanks ( AMM TASK 12-11-01-600-801-A/300), as applicable. (4) Examine for fuel leakage the access panels which were removed. (5) On the circuit breaker panel, close the circuit breakers below and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from them: • FUEL PUMPS 1A/1B/1C. • FUEL PUMPS 2A/2B/2C. • START 1/2.
